title: Brazil's Vivo shares rise after Telesp integration proposal
author: Reuters Staff
description: Shares of Brazil's largest mobile phone company Vivo jumped on Tuesday after the company unveiled plans to be integrated into Telefonica's local fixed-line phone unit.
cleaned_text: * Vivo shares climb on plans to be folded under Telesp * Telefonica's Telesp unit shares fall RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec 28 (Reuters) - Shares of Brazil's largest mobile phone company Vivo jumped on Tuesday after the company unveiled plans to be integrated into Telefonica's local fixed-line phone unit. Vivo's most-traded preferred shares [VIVO4.SA](/companies/VIVO4.SA) climbed 1.7 percent to 53.42 reais in early trading, compared with a 0.3 percent gain in the benchmark Bovespa index [.BVSP](/quote/.BVSP). Telefonica's Brazilian fixed-line unit 40.32 reais. Spain's [TEF.MC](/companies/TEF.MC) agreed in July to buy Portugal Telecom's [PTC.LS](/companies/PTC.LS) stake in Vivo for 7.5 billion euros ($9.9 billion), becoming the controlling shareholder of the Brazilian wireless company. [ID:nN28196592] In a securities filing late on Monday, Vivo and Telesp said the move was part of a plan to cut costs and simplify the shareholding structure of the two companies in a bid to boost trading volumes under one single-listed entity.
